thread.title: Briefly: Ghosts, Goblins and Goalies Fun Run Sunday, Oct. 18
thread.title_full: Briefly: Ghosts, Goblins and Goalies Fun Run Sunday, Oct. 18

title: Briefly: Ghosts, Goblins and Goalies Fun Run Sunday, Oct. 18
text: Briefly: Ghosts, Goblins and Goalies Fun Run Sunday, Oct. 18 (Mark Yadron/Courtesy Photo) The Prescott Blackhawks will host the annual Ghost, Goblins and Goalies Fun Run and carnival on Sunday, Oct. 18, at Granite Creek Park from 3 to 5 p.m. with a live remote by Magic 99.1. Pictured left to right are: Alexa Sell, Emma Alvarez, Riley Smith, Hailey Mayhan and Lauryn Mayhan. The Fun Run raises money for the Prescott Blackhawks Foundation, which is a not-for-profit organization that allows many local players to pursue their competitive soccer dreams when financial limitations would not otherwise allow it. Registration for the event begins at 2:30 p.m. and the Fun Run entry fee is $20 (discounts for multiple family members available). Carnival booths will also add to the fun at $1 per ticket. Prizes will be given to the fastest girl and boy runner as well as the best Halloween costume. So bring out your whole family and enjoy this fun event that supports the Prescott Blackhawks Foundation. FENCINGWORLD-RENOWNED FENCING MASTER Yves Auriol will be conducting a clinic on fencing at the Prescott Athletic and Tennis Club, 1 Kingswood Drive, Saturday, Oct. 17. Maitre' Auriol was the USA Olympic fencing coach for four Olympic Games, and was coach at Notre Dame University in South Bend, Indiana, for 17 years. Visitors are welcome at no charge. For more information, call the club at 928-227-3417 or send an email to: patc.club@gmail.com. GOLFTHE FORMAT AT QUAILWOOD GREENS Men's Club near Dewey on Wednesday, Oct. 14, was 'Two-Man team, pick your partner Team Net score and Flighted.' In the 'A' Flight, Larry Fisher and Stan Skura were the first-place winners. Two groups were tied, including Stewart Hopkins and Mike Tucker, and Bob Weaver and Kevin Kobus. In the 'B' Flight, Joe Warren and Jack Lambert were the first-place winners. Ken Kies and Jim Thorp came in second, followed by Justin Barr and Cameron Kolbe in third. 'Closest to the Pin' winners were: Bob Weaver on hole Nos. 2, 5 and 7; Tommy Pomeroy (Nos. 3 and 13); Mike Tucker (No. 11); and Domenic Lomedico (No. 16). THE GAME FOR PRESCOTT GOLF & COUNTRY CLUB'S MEN'S CLUB Sept. 23 was 'Individual Nassau.' Winners on the course near Dewey were: B. Bordner (front nine), F. Boehm (back nine) and R. Wetzel (total). RUNNINGTHE BACK OF THE PACK running group is starting its next training session at 10 a.m. Oct. 24, on the outdoor track at the Prescott YMCA . Back of the Pack offers a non-competitive running group that combines 50 years of running experience and more than 50 completed half-marathons. The group encourages runners to train during a 12-week session to complete the 'Rock & Roll' 5K, 10K or half-marathon Jan. 16 and 17, 2016, in Phoenix. A training fee of $70 covers individualized training plans, group support, race day prep and support, weekly emails, and fun! For more information, call Lynn at 802-688-4511 or Patrice at 928-308-2705, or send an email to backofthepack@gmail.com. Like the group on Facebook at: www.facebook.com/backofthepackrunningclub. YOUTH SOCCERATTENTION YOUTH SOCCER PLAYERS in the tri-city area. Yavapai Soccer Club needs select soccer players for its Boys U-14 (02) and U-13 (03) age groups. Also, the U-11 boys request a response from boys who may be interested in playing goalkeeper. If interested, contact via email: U-14 (gittinsent@cableone.net); U-13 (soccersteve68@gmail.com) and U-11 (JuanMontoya39@HSN.com) for information. YOUTH SOFTBALLBATBUSTERS FASTPITCH SOFTBALL'S 14U team is holding open tryouts for its 2016 season. Batbusters coach James Schmidt said it's a highly competitive team with great coaches who have great knowledge of the game. "We focus on fundamentals, conditioning, (and) mental preparation in a competitive environment," he added. The squad's season runs from January through November. Tryouts will go from 9 to 10:30 a.m. Oct. 17 at Bill Valley Upper Field next to Yavapai College in Prescott. The Batbusters were 2014 Arizona Amateur Softball Association Class B State Champions. They have also qualified for the 2016 Nationals. For more information, call Schmidt at 928-830-5486. YOUTH BASEBALL ACADEMYHITTING COACH Rob Chriss is offering what he's calling the Process Driven Baseball Academy to tri-city area players ages 9-12. The academy takes place from Sept. 14 through Nov. 16 at Ziegler Field, 1200 Commerce Drive, in Prescott. Sessions include instruction in mental approach, dynamics of the game, throwing, fielding, base running, hitting, infielding and outfielding. The 10-week program conducts sessions from 6:30-8 p.m. every Monday during those two months. One day of camp costs $55, or $425 for the entire 10-week session. To register, call Chriss at 928-308-5822 or email him at: robertmchriss@yahoo.com.
